attributes.comment:
I would like to submit my disagreement with the proposal to raise the fees
required for foreign orphan petitions. We are currently in the middle of our 2nd
international adoption. The myriad of fees required is staggering, but we pay them
because we love our children and feel called to adopt. The fee we paid this winter
was already substantially more than we paid in 2000 when we submitted our first
I600-A. We also waited over 3 months in 2000 and almost 2 months this winter to
receive our Favorable Determination Letters (I171-H). This winter we asked to
have expedited service because our new daughter has a spine condition which
needs medical attention. It still took almost 2 months, and the approval did not
leave the office for 7 days after the approval date. If a fee must be imposed, it
should lead to much better and quicker service. The service should also be of
similar time lengths at all offices. Currently some offices approve in a week, some
take several months. Perhaps offering expedited service for an additional fee
would be a solution. Most people adopting are not wealthy and struggle to pay
the fees involved, often going into debt to do so. We are U.S. citizens who should
have the opportunity to bring children into our families as we choose, and should
not be continually subjected to higher and higher fees.
Thank you.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Sharul Rapavy
